review.title: Prediction of the Yield of Enzymatic Synthesis of Betulinic Acid Ester Using Artificial Neural Networks and Support Vector Machine
review.abstract: 3\b{eta}-O-phthalic ester of betulinic acid is of great importance in anticancer studies. However, the optimization of its reaction conditions requires a large number of experimental works. To simplify the number of times of optimization in experimental works, here, we use artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) models for the prediction of yields of 3\b{eta}-O-phthalic ester of betulinic acid synthesized by betulinic acid and phthalic anhydride using lipase as biocatalyst. General regression neural network (GRNN), multilayer feed-forward neural network (MLFN) and the SVM models were trained based on experimental data. Four indicators were set as independent variables, including time (h), temperature (C), amount of enzyme (mg) and molar ratio, while the yield of the 3\b{eta}-O-phthalic ester of betulinic acid was set as the dependent variable. Results show that the GRNN and SVM models have the best prediction results during the testing process, with comparatively low RMS errors (4.01 and 4.23respectively) and short training times (both 1s). The prediction accuracy of the GRNN and SVM are both 100% in testing process, under the tolerance of 30%.

metadata.title: Prediction of the Yield of Enzymatic Synthesis of Betulinic Acid Ester Using Artificial Neural Networks and Support Vector Machine

sections.text: 3β-O phthalic ester of betulinic acid is of great importance in cancer studies. However, the optimization of its reaction conditions requires a large number of experimental works. To simplify the number of optimization times in experimental work, we use artificial neural networks (ANN) and supporting vector machines (SVM) models to predict the yields of 3β-O phthalic esters of betulinic acid and phthalic anhydrides using lipase as a biocatalyst. General neural regression network (GRNN), multilayer feed-forward neural network (MLFN) and the SVM models were trained on the basis of experimental data. Four indicators were determined as independent variables, including time (h), temperature (ºC), amount of enzymes (mg) and molar ratio, while the yields of the 3β-O phthalic acid betuluric acid test results of SVN1- and SVN1- respectively, showed the best SVN1- in the SVN cells.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.text: This year, we have reached the point where we feel we are in a position to achieve the objectives I have mentioned, but we do not feel we are in a position to achieve them.

sections.heading: 3 Results and Discussion
sections.text: In fact, most of them will be able to move to a different world in which they are able to live than in a world in which they are able to live and live.

sections.heading: Conclusion
sections.text: 3β-O-phthalic acid esters of betulinic acid are of great importance in clinical research. Here, we successfully find that the application of ANNs and SVM is useful for predicting the yields of 3β-O-phthalic esters of betulinic acid synthesized by betulinic acid and phthalic anhydride using lipase as a biocatalyst. Results show that the GRNN and the SVM model have the best predictive results during the test process, with comparatively low RMS errors (4.01 and 4.23, respectively) and short training times (both 1s). The predictive accuracy of the GRNN and SVM are both 100% in the test process within a tolerance of 30%. Both the GRNN and SVM exhibit very good repeatability and robustness. Our research successfully demonstrates that machine learning, like ANNs and SVM, can be used to predict the yield of organic and synthesis conditions.

sections.heading: Conflict of Interests
sections.text: The authors declare that they have no conflict of interest.

sections.heading: Financial support

The detailed approaches for the synthesis of 3β-O-phthalic ester of betulinic acid based on chemical catalytic esterification have been reported by previous research reports(Mukherjee et al., 2004; Kvasnica et al., 2005; Mukherjee et al., 2006; Rajendran et al., 2008), which have several disadvantages (e.
high energy consumption and by-products) (Yasin et al., 2008).

Compared with traditional chemical approaches, the application of enzymes in organic synthesis offers a series of advantages, including high catalytic efficiency, high selectivity, mild reaction condition and high product purity and quality (Loughlin, 2000; Zarevúcka and Wimmer, 2008).

Compared with traditional chemical approaches, the application of enzymes in organic synthesis offers a series of advantages, including high catalytic efficiency, high selectivity, mild reaction condition and high product purity and quality (Loughlin, 2000; Zarevúcka and Wimmer, 2008). However, the best detailed conditions for the synthesis are difficult to obtain due to the large-scale and complex laboratory experiments. Moghaddam and colleagues(2010) used artificial neural network (ANN) models to develop models for predicting the yield of enzymatic synthesis of betulinic acid ester.
